definition: Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
joyful/kind
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: Gu laid great emphasis on the three hairs, and Pei was very satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 顾恺之却把这三根汗毛画得特别突出，裴楷非常满意。

sentences.english: It is said to go back to the painter Ku K'ai-chi, who lived in the fourth century AD.
sentences.chinese: 据说原本出自公元4世纪的画家顾恺之的手笔。

sentences.english: The form for the aesthetical view of Gu Kai's has epoch-making significance.
sentences.chinese: 顾恺之美学观的形成具有划时代的意义。

definition: Lu Tanwei (active c. 450-490), one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
Zhang Sengyou (active c. 490-540), one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家

Wang Xizhi (303-361), famous calligrapher of Eastern Jin, known as the sage of calligraphy 書聖|书圣
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
Yu Shinan (558-638), politician of Sui and early Tang periods, poet and calligrapher, one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Tang Bohu 唐伯虎 or Tang Yin (1470-1523), Ming painter and poet, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
Zhang Zeduan (1085-1145), Song dynasty painter
Xu Wei, Chinese painter
short comments/preface and postscript
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Zhu Yunming (1460-1526), Ming dynasty calligrapher
